description: I've ordered delivery from this restaurant a few times and the quality of food and flavors have been great. Dining at the restaurant for the first time, I'm glad to note the quality of the dishes was spot on.  Having been to Thailand and many other Thai restaurants in the Bay Area, flavor wise I would say the dishes were a tad lacking in that Thai "kick" I've grown to love - the perfect combination of texture and spice. The fried fish dish we had was flavorful and very eye appealing, however, for the price point, perhaps the fish portion size could have been a tad more.  If you are used to traditional, bold Thai flavors, ask for a side of prik nam pla like we did and spice up your dishes.  Overall, not a bad experience at all.  Service was very friendly.
author: Roger E.

description:
I had dinner here a couple weeks ago for the first time and was pleasantly surprised at how nice the restaurant looked. It was clean, modern, and with good simple decor. The food, however, was mediocre. We ordered this dish that had five spoons with a big prawn and quail egg in each, accompanied by two dipping sauces. The prawns were fresh and had a good "crunch" to them, but I don't think that they justified the $15 price point. My fiance ordered a beef noodle soup and was disappointed that the noodles were more similar to pho noodles than the flat rice noodles that usually come with it. He also felt like the noodles were a little overcooked and therefore too soft. I ordered the eggplant salad and felt that it wasn't really a salad. In fact, looking at the "salads" section of the menu, most of the items listed there don't really qualify to be under that category. Red onions, green onions, cilantro, and mint do not a salad make. But I've been trying to eat healthier and chose to order it anyway. It was mediocre and came in an overall small portion size given that the ingredients to make it are very inexpensive.

The waitresses at this restaurant were excellent - they were friendly and quick to fill up our water cups. However, the food wasn't good enough for me to be returning.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Was visiting the Bay Area for work and visiting some friends who live in Inner Sunset neighborhood. They ordered in from here for dinner. 

They ordered a few different things for us to share. Starter was the fried calamari with chili jam. The pieces were very big from the batter which made it hard to share, but the crispy basil on top was super good. 

For mains, we shared Thai fried rice with chicken, red curry with shrimp, pad Thai, and a pumpkin stir fry with ground chicken and veggies. The coconut curry was good and had some heat to it, which I always like, but there were only a few shrimp in it. The pumpkin stir fry was good. I loved the flavor and texture of the pumpkin in the dish, but the rest of the dish was missing some depth of flavor. 

The Thai fried rice was not as spicy as I prefer and needed to be paired with some of the other dishes to give it some more flavor. Pad Thai was ok, but the noodle were very soft. 

To finish, we had the mango sticky rice which was pretty good. Overall everything was fine but wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Ashtar B.

description: A hidden gem. Chaiya has been my go to for good Thai food since I moved to sf. Their food is always fresh, service is great, and everything comes out in a timely manner. I recommend This place to anyone in west portal area looking for a tasty meal.
author: Olivia E.

description: Very nice Thai restaurant. Took a quick stop before going to Golden Gate Bridge. The kids like the pad Thai and the fried rice. We also loved the tom kha soup and the fresh spring rolls. The server was very sweet and the service was fast.
author: PP G.

description: Authentic Thai food. All the item on the menu looked so good that I wanted to get everything lol. This place statisfied all my Thai cravings. Too bad the location is a little outside of West Portal or else I would think that they will have a heavier traffic. Def get the curry, it was so freaken good.
author: Edna L.

description: What a great Thai restaurant!! Everything I have tried here were great! The yum noodle, padwoonsen, curry, curry puff, etc! Very authentic and have a nice atmosphere as well.
author: Aini T.

description: My favorite spot in the  neighborhood for dinner! Food is always quick, fresh, and tasty. Portions on the noodle dishes could be bigger but the portion is made up for in quality. Service is consistent and there's never a wait.
author: Ryan L.

description: First they forgot the side of rice that we ordered. Then we find out they gave us old bruised mangos for our mango sticky rice. What kind of food quality is this?? Just because we ordered delivery and are not presently there to inspect the food, does not mean you can cheap out on your quality and service.
author: Quynh N.

description:
Chaiya has really great food but the portions are a little smaller than you'd want for the prices.  The one gripe I've found with the Pad See Ew is that there are not enough noodles or broccoli in it.  Strangely enough, it's mostly meat.  It's not as satisfying when you eat it because you don't get as much of those smooth sticky yummy noodles as you want.  

I also do not like that they use regular broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli (the last time I ordered, I got 4 small florets in the whole dish).  The flavors are on point but the dish just really needs more noodles, which would bulk up the portion to what it should be and also make to ratios better too.  

The lemon chicken is out of the world and the yellow curry is one of the best I've ever had (nice thick-but-not-too-thick consistency and it's also not too sweet the way so many yellow curries are).  
If Chaiya slightly lowered their prices or increased their portions, I would order from them once a week.  As it is, I only order it as a treat yo self.
author: Emma H.

description:
Chaiya Thai was completely empty when we entered for dinner, so I was a little concerned. We were greeted warmly, escorted to a table, and handed some thick and hefty menus. But from where I was sitting, something caught my eye on the opposite wall:

App Combo - combination crisp appetizers. Ooh, let's start with that. Then it was back to the menu. We ordered Pad Thai and Seafood Paradise, with jasmine rice on the side.

The App Combo was excellent, since everything was fried. Tofu triangles, spring rolls, boneless chicken, imitation crab meat and cream cheese wontons, and finally a super thin egg roll. Each item was crispy and light. I just wish they told us which item was which so we could order it on our next visit.

The Pad Thai was also excellent. Yes, every Thai restaurant serves this dish, so it's a good yardstick to compare. The plate was big enough so that I could mix the ingredients together without making a huge mess. The Pad Thai was very fresh and tasty. I really liked it. 

But the unquestionable highlight of our meal was the Seafood Paradise: mussels, shrimp, calamari, and red snapper, in a light yellow curry sauce with pumpkin cubes. It was outstanding! I love mussels, there were two in the bowl. The calamari strips were tender, and the red snapper melted in our mouths. Everything was cooked perfectly.

Although there weren't many other diners in the restaurant with us, they had plenty of take-out customers. People were coming in and out of the restaurant to pick up their orders throughout our meal.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
Ambience: intimate and good for groups or dates

Parking: metered parking nearby on West Portal or free 2hr residential parking nearby as well

Service: very attentive and friendly!!

Pricing: pretty average for Thai food

Food: 
we started out with the fresh spring rolls, which is different than your usual Thai spring rolls. These had way more mixed greens than other stuff. It was light but I don't think it's worth paying for...for mixed greens rolled up 

Thai fried rice with chicken: very flavorful and tasty. Portion size is pretty good - enough to take home leftovers (portion control or something?)

Tofu Praram with a side of jasmine rice: sweet, salty & flavorful. Sweetness of the peanut sauce complemented the vegetables and tofu and went really well with rice. It was a bit on the saltier side for me though.
author: Cheri C.

description: Fantastic Thai restaurant with lovely customer service. My family loves Chaiya- highly recommend!! :)
author: Pamela ..

description: This place is so yummy!  I first discovered them on Uber eats, but today I saw I can order without an additional fee through yelp as long as I spent $20+ so I'll be ordering through here moving forward.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Nothing lasts forever. This Thai joint may have once been a great restaurant, but that is no longer the case.

Looked on yelp for some delivery options. We chose this restaurant instead of another because of the online photos. The Pad Thai looked really good. (Don't be deceived by the photos!!).

We ordered one chicken Pad Thai and one shrimp Pad Thai. All of the online photos showed delicious golden noodles, and deep fried crispy tofu. Boy, was that not the case. 

Girl over the phone told us delivery would take 45 minutes to an hour. We order lots of delivery from restaurants throughout West Portal. The delivery is always pretty fast as we live close by. Never the full wait time.

When the food arrived over an hour later, it was mushy. Flavors were bland. The noodles were sooo overcooked they were falling apart! The tofu was barely cooked! This is my biggest woe. Seriously, we got a plate full of raw tofu. Not deep fried crispy tofu as it should be. Not even sautéed. Just hunks of raw tofu. :(
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Went here with a large group. The service was fine, but the food quality was inconsistent and a bit small. The thai ice tea was overly sweet and also left an odd aftertaste. We tried several of the appetizers, and all were delicious. When it came to the main dish, I ordered the seafood pad kee maw. The pad kee maw itself was fine (though this was also my first time ordering it, so I'm not sure what the standard pad kee maw should taste like). However, the seafood in it didn't seem fresh. Though the ratio of seafood to noodles was good, some of the seafood in my dish (like the fish and the mussels) didn't taste quite right, and I left the place with a slight stomach ache. Other people in my group seemed to enjoy their dishes (some also ordered pad kee maw), so if I ever come back, I'll probably just avoid any dishes with fish or mussels.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Delivery longer than one hour.
Thai ice tea way too sweet.
Pumpkin not fully cooked but flavor was there.
Pork a bit over cooked.
Coconut chicken soup was good.
author: Henry C.

description:
On the very sad days when I both eat at my desk *and* don't bring a lunch, I order postmates. Today I ordered from Chaiya for the first time and it was delicious! The lunch special (soup, egg roll, entree, rice) was flavorful and cheap at $10 with enough food to have a bit leftover ($17 with tip and delivery). 

At least if I have to work through lunch, it can be delicious ;)
author: Semuteh F.

description: I was a little skeptical upon arriving because the place was completely empty, but we did show up an hour before closing so I wasn't too shocked. The service was nice and attentive. The food came quickly and steaming hot. The place had a nice ambiance and the food was really good-I got the pad kee mow with tofu. My boyfriend got the pra ram, which he gets at every Thai place we go to. He said it wasn't the best he's had, but still pretty good. Would go to again :)
author: Ann Marie D.

description: Chaiya Thai always hits the spot. Perfect place for family dinner , filled with friendly staff, chill atmosphere, and bomb food . I have ordered to-go & delivery here before and my order is always right , quickly made, and flavorful .
author: Alyson T.

description:
Chaiya is a convenient Thai restaurant located at West Portal.

I usually get their pad thai or fried rice options, along with some appetizers. The food is pretty tasty but average compared to other Thai restaurants in SF.

In my most recent visit, we ordered their chicken karaage and glazed calamari appetizers -- both very solid small bites. We got the massaman curry special with sticky rice on the side -- I felt this curry had a good, rich flavor but it was quite salty and the chicken wings were sort of strange to have within the curry. We also got their eggplant merlot and Chaiya pan fried noodles, both of which were too oily for my preference

The service is pretty friendly and nice.
author: Alvin W.

description: Almost inclined to give this two stars but will go with three because I was here once before this visit and things were solidly average.  This time, I had the food delivered via Amazon Prime.  We had the Golden Basket, which contained virtually no imitation crab and a ton of cream cheese -- -plus, they were burned on the edges.  The tom yum soup was very good.  But the main course, Sweet Pumpkin Basil, was an epic fail.  It was just meat and chunks of pumpkin and some onions -- no sauce, no unifying ingredient to give this some definition or personality.  We should have ordered the pumpkin curry, I guess, so that we'd get something that tasted like something.  We won't waste time with this place again.
author: Jill T.

description: Small portions and the flavor of the food wasn't the best. The pad Thai wasn't good at all.
author: Lea W.

description: Wow... not sure what to say. Mushy noodles. NO FLAVOR. Raw tofu. Taste like bad Chinese food. Prices do not match portions. Tom Kha soup was all coco milk with little to no chicken. Save yourself the disappointment... don't try the new place, stick to your old go to Thai or try another, any other.
author: Alonso C.

description:
I have been to this restaurant several times, a great find. The waiter is very congenial take some time to talk to him. We have never been disappointed at the service and quality of their food ,they are able to adjust the ingredients of their dishes to please  each customer . The restaurant has plenty of seating, don't let the emptiness of the restaurant discourage you from entering.  If you're looking for a quiet restaurant to sit and talk with friends, this is the place for you.  AN OUTSTANDING FEATURE OF THIS RESTAURANT IS THAT THEY DO NOT USE MSG as many Asian restaurants do.
Don't believe the negative reviews..Let your taste buds be the judge.
author: K T.

description: I went there and order Pad thai, Papaya salad ,duck curry with drink palm sugar juice. Very delicious and original Thai taste. Good environment and friendly staff. Recommended to try
author: Berry I.

description:
Unless it's new, I'm always shocked when I come across a restaurant like Chaiya that hasn't been reviewed by any of my Yelp friends (correction: Priscilla W. now has!).  Shocked, but also intrigued.  Because as much as I might worry why no one has tried this place, there's always that possibility it's an undiscovered gem!  Although, in this case...

Somewhat hidden from the rest of West Portal (it's on Claremont, around the corner from the station), Chaiya is a quaint spot that's easy to overlook.  The restaurant itself is decently nice and clean, with a wealth of tables for groups large or small.  Like the decor, the menu is pretty modern as well, though compared to some of the city's newer spots, it's more basic than extensive/unique.

-- CORN FRITTER - Battered Fried Corn with Thai Herbs, Spices, Chopped Kaffir Lime Leaves, and a Sweet Chili Sauce...$6
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chaiya-thai-restaurant-san-francisco-2#mHu4pCXLx308b2MD3okQGQ)
Not bad, but the texture/consistency was a little off.  I liked how the corn wasn't overly sweet and how crispy it was, but the core was a bit gummy.  The ones I recently had at Tycoon Thai in the TL were better, though.

-- CHAIYA SPECIAL NOODLES - Seafood Combination sautéed with Flat Rice Noodles in Chili Paste...$15
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chaiya-thai-restaurant-san-francisco-2#_rEEQ1OajhDcAiEaRISy2A)
I feared the usual "seafood combination" (chewy squid, tasteless shrimp, etc.), so the fish and mussels were welcome surprises.  The noodles had the right bite and the chili paste added just enough heat to balance the sauce's sweetness.  The overall taste didn't amaze, but it was pretty solid.

-- LAVA CHICKEN - Marinated Grilled Deep Fried Thighs Topped with Bell Pepper, Onions, Cilantro, and Signature Plum Sauce...$14
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chaiya-thai-restaurant-san-francisco-2#-yhabMownv7E_UoxOH-yGg)
Those four big pieces got us excited, but this was a huge miss.  The sauce was spicy (albeit sweet), but the chicken was TORCHED.  Impressive, since I've never had dark meat so overcooked and dry before.  I thought it was a typo, but maybe it really was cooked twice ("grilled deep fried").

Since coming here, I had been debating whether to round up or down from TWO AND A HALF STARS, but I ultimately decided to round up.  As bad as the chicken was, it was just one dish.  Plus, given their location and wealth of parking, they're very convenient for dining in or doing take out (they also deliver).  I just don't know if I'll be back.  If/when I do, I'll probably avoid their chicken dishes...
author: Mike L.

description: Acceptable Thai take out to satisfy cravings. Service is consistently prompt and pleasant.  Slightly greasy but haven't had pad see ew that wasn't.
author: Slone F.

description: Nice restaurant, no waiting, good food. Hidden gem in West Portal neighborhood. I have been coming here for last few years and food has been really good.
author: AJAY G.

description:
Hidden from the busier side of West Portal, Chaiya Thai is closer to the residential side of neighborhood and easy to miss. However, they offer decent Thai food in a low-key environment.

We started off with the Tom Yum soup, which was very warming on a cool, rainy day. It was nicely balanced with both sweet and sour flavors, both complimenting each other well. Mushrooms and protein (in our case, chicken) were plentiful.

One of our main entrees, the pineapple fried rice (which they call Hawaiian fried rice), was rather salty, despite the fact that they claim to not use MSG. The chicken was very dry and chewy too. I also felt like the kitchen threw this dish together too sloppily, as we had a few clusters of white rice and raisins stuck together, not distributed evenly throughout the whole dish. Our second entree, the grilled salmon in banana leaf, was also a little dry and unfortunately bland. The banana leaf was huge, given the impression the salmon filet would be a generous portion; however, upon unwrapping the leaf, the filet was actually small.

We finished off with the sweet sticky rice with mango dessert. The portion was huge and very rich and filling. After the Tom Yum, the dessert was probably the next best dish of the night.

Chaiya is quite spacious, modern, clean, and welcoming, and they're perfect for large groups. Service is very attentive and friendly, and our food came out quickly. Given the heavily-residential area, parking in this neighborhood is generally easy. Or if you're too lazy to drive here and find parking, they deliver too!
author: Priscilla W.

description:
sampled some of there dishes through Door Dash on a weekend dinner here is what I tried and how it faired

Tom Yum - hot & sour soup with shrimp, the soup had mushrooms, lemongrass, lime leaves and cilantro, the soup did have a kick, shrimp was also a plus, about 8 full sized shrimps, it is the kinda soup where if it hits the lips it burns (DEELIISHOUSSSS)

Volcano Duck - boneless roasted ducin in spicy garlic sauce with steamed veggies and crispy basil, not to fatty, more meat then skin, I will order this again, heat level was moderate for me

Green Curry - bamboo shoots eggplant string beans bell peppers & fresh basil with chicken, one of the more flavorful dishes we ordered then again which curries are not flavorful, skimpy on the chicken but the sauce and veggies were so infused with the curry almost like you didn't need the meat for this dish

Thai Fried Rice - fried rice with egg, onion, tomato, carrots, green peas standard and full flavored dish, not super oily like most places, I would order this again.

I read the other reviews, maybe dining at home might be better haha didn't expect that much flavor from a togo menu

food ****
price $$
service **** convenience of ordering online and having it delivered so worth the wait
author: Clarence A.

description: Horrible service!!!!!! Rude people on the phone. They didn't include the rice when I paid for it and gave me a hard time. DO NOT RECOMMEND. Rude people and mediocre food. F this place.
author: April D.

description:
I will never try this restaurant anymore. I used to like it very much because my friend part time there and they offered valuable food.
This time they gave me like 10 small pieces chicken as Lava chicken (they offered 4 big full pieces before). But they still charge the same price.
It's unbelievable!!!
author: Zhi Z.

description:
Good for lunch, no wait, fast and tasty if you order the right things like the Green curry is aromatic and savory.

Avoid the Tom Yum, I've never been around for dinner so I don't know if it's different then, but it's really flat for the lunch special.  Otherwise the service, homey setting and curry is great and for $7 a pretty decent lunch deal.  

If you are curious about the lunch Tom Yum, my expectations were really low going in (for $4 sure base it off a paste, who's got time for all that grinding and kaffir lime isn't cheap) and it was still sad even adding shrimp.  It was white mushrooms and cilantro floating around with some chili flakes and oil. The stock was bland and no account of lime juice and fish sauce was fixing that.  Like you need to boil some shrimp heads, or better yet fry them with chilies and use that spicy shrimp oil.  I mean there's enough headless shrimp in my lame soup that the lack of flavor is inexcusable.  No I do not want a to go container for this chili lime water.  Anyway I was happy with everything else.
author: Jennifer L.

description: We just celebrated my mother in law's 91 birthday at this Wonderful restaurant. Not only was the food and service terrific, but they went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and comfortable. They graciously allowed us to bring our own birthday cake and supplied us with plates and forks. They took pictures of our group and accommodated our pre-order. They even presented a lovely gift to the birthday girl. How can we thank you enough?. I want my birthday there when I'm 91...Lol
author: Lois D.

description: I went with my mom to eat here on a thursday after noon. We were starving!!! When we got there we ordered Panang Curry and Pad Thai. Our food arrived in 10 min and we dug in! The curry was astounding! (One of the best I've ever had) the pad Thai was also good but not as good as the curry! Love this place definitely coming back!!!
author: Andrew K.

description: Ordered over two hours ago. We called to check and Chaiya says they did not receive an order from us despite Eat 24 confirmation and that we should call them.
author: Janet L.

description:
This place is located more towards the residential area of West Portal. Came here on a Monday night at 6pm and there were two other tables. The service was kind of nonexistent. Our waitress seemed like she didn't want to be there.

I came here a few times before and decided to try it again. I noticed the portion size got a lot smaller. I ordered:

-chicken pad kee mow
Small portion size but overall pretty good. You get generous amounts of meat. Would order again!

-chicken green curry with a side of jasmine rice
There wasn't much in the curry. This had one piece of eggplant, some bean sprouts, red pepper, bamboo shoots, and a few pieces of chicken. The coconut milk had a really strong presence in the curry. Wouldn't order again.
author: Bing L.

description:
A toddler can cook better than your chef. That is probably not fun to hear, but it is also not much fun receiving a delivery of food that if i wasn't starving, i'd throw it all out immediately vs what i did which is to throw just half..

I ordered the Panang Curry, plain rice to go with that and sweet sticky rice with mango:

Panang curry - very weird flavor, over whelming and just bad.
*How to correct? Red curry is based on fresh red chili paste, coconut milk, Thai basil, kafir lime leaves, peanuts and lemon grass. needs to be balanced, not too thick. 

Plain jasmine rice  - Absolutely terrible! Soggy, wet, over cooked.
**How to correct? Well, start with less water, and end with less cooking. shouldn't be teaching a chef to make simple rice.

Sweet sticky rice with mango - Basically the rice from above that was mixed with sugar and not enough of it, like you are not sure if you are eating a dessert or dog food, with sliced unripe mango.  
*How to correct? when you serve something as simple and cheap as sticky rice, make it special by adding flavor to the cooking syrup. like lemon grass coconut or ginger for example. then, get some good mangoes or buy them a week ahead so they are ripe by the time u use them. 

I always think 3 times before leaving a review that can hurt someone especially being a chef myself and knowing what it feels like to be under reviewer's knife, but there is food that isn't great and food that is just a disgrace to serve especially to ppl who payed a lot for it.
I think that a restaurant that serves food like that should close it's doors for good and leave it for professionals to do it.

You are a Thai restaurant and Thai food is amazing! respect the culture that you represent with your cooking and go home or make major changes.
author: Eli E.

description: Oh how I love thai food. This spot is above and beyond my expectation when I decided to come here. The menu looked delicious before I even got here. Went here tonight with the lady and my mind, mouth, and stomach were HIGHLY SATISFIED! The staff here are the kindest EVER. The ladies are so nice!! The artwork and ambience of the restaurant is just incredible. I ordered the mango trout and it was AMAZING AND FLAVORFUL! Just an absolute treat to come here. Definitely recommending this place to everyone..even y'all reading this post! Just a great evening out with the lady enjoying some very exquisite dining in West Portal!
author: Robert F.

description: Good service and good food.  My go to place for good Thai food.  The servers are attentive and very patient when it comes to large parties.
author: Usha G.

description:
I was seriously craving Thai food and decided to try a restaurant right off the busy West Portal Ave, and boy was I elated to find my new go-to lunch spot. I love coming here for the ambiance, spaciousness, and affordable lunch menu. Service is very attentive and friendly, and food always comes out quickly. Everytime I visit, the staff is willing to share about the Thai culture and will teach me a new phrase/word with each visit. 

Favorite starter: 
-Wing Wing- crispy chicken wings with fried basil. Love how the sweet crispy exterior, and juicy balanced the meaty interior. 

My go to entrees from their $7 lunch menu:
-Pumpkin curry with chicken and white rice-- Favorite for the flavor and texture of the curry
-Pad Thai-- tends to be sweeter than the previous ones I've tried, but still good if you like the heavier flavor.   

They also have their specials for $8 during lunch: 
-Childhood Fried Rice- Fried pork (like katsu) with peas, carrots, egg fried rice. 

Other:
Tom Yum Soup- just as advertised. :)
author: Priscilla C.

description:
TL;DR: Pad thai is boring and small

This review is based off a delivery of their $10 Pad Thai from UberEats.

Considering that Pad Thai is probably the most popular Thai dish in America, I generally start with Pad Thai when going to a new restaurant. I was surprised by how tasteless the Pad Thai was. It had all the right ingredients: noodles, ground up peanuts, green onion, eggs, tofu, bean spouts. But the flavor was altogether bland and boring. A squirt of the provided lemon slice helped slightly.

I was also disappointed with the size of the meal. I was left unsatisfied by the flavor as well as the portion. I ended up grabbing a snack from my pantry afterwards to fill my stomach.

I don't know what the rest of the menu is like but I would not recommend their Pad Thai unless they kick up their recipe a few notches.
author: Samuel J.

description: Don't do it. Delivery took almost 2 hours. Rude woman on the phone when I called. The food was pretty gross. At almost $40, i put about $30 of food straight in the trash.
author: Scott B.

description:
This is better than all other sunset Thai food that I tried so far. Phew, I am glad I have a place to order Thai grub from.

Excellent fried rice and Pad see Mao
author: An u.

description: This is about the delivery service.    Had delivery in the past, then spoke with Por, who said that for .1 miles we had to pay extra $5 for delivery.   Really ridiculous.   This may once have been a great restaurant, but this is no longer the case.   Evidently, the owner and the manager were not there, and the service showed.
author: Yang Q.

description:
Yellow curry with chicken and large rice - yum!
Pad See Ew with only broccoli - awesome. 

We will be eating this regularly as we recover from our move. 

Thank you for the great veggie suggestions too!
author: Christine V.

description: Good food. Thai operated, authentic as you can get. Got the green curry and lava chicken, both were delicious and fairly priced. Inside is nice and quiet cozy ambience. Very popular for take out
author: Ian J.

description: Charming unpretentious delicious Thai food.  Gracious service and presentation of original culinary selections. We enjoyed the Shrimp Pad Thai, the Siren Beef, a chicken curry and a ginger beef pad Thai.  The Argentine Padrillos Winery Malbec was an excellent and smooth choice for the neal.
author: A. L.

description:
I ordered Tomyum soup and Pad Thai shared with my mom.

Tomyum over seasoned and taste like the Tomyum paste you can buy from the Asian supermarket for $4. And they put too much fish sauce.

The Pad Thai was bad, the noodle was not cooked completely and the sauce was too much. 

I will not come back again even the service was good. 

I will go back to the Thai noodle in Clement. Even though parking is really annoying there. 

But honestly when you see your customer can't finish half way of the food. They should think about why.
author: Johnny J.

description:
3.5 STARS, BUT I ROUND UP BECAUSE I DON'T WANNA SEEM LIKE A 8===D.

So I've been here twice now, and both times haven't been bad, yet not WOW either... but I know I left with the thoughts, "Yeah, I'd come here again... better than King of Thai..."

Came here on a late Sunday night (~9PM) with the boys because this was somewhat in the neighborhood, and Thai was the only thing the 3 of us could agree on... (I hate boys)

Parking was easy at this hour since everything in the West Portal district closes by 9ish. Free metered parking or easy street parking on Claremont. 

It was fairly empty when we got there (as expected), and we ordered the fried calamari right off the bat because I NEEEEEED to try it everywhere I go.

Fried Calamari: These aren't like your rings and legs kinda calamari. These are more like fried squid-looking pieces, but the sauce it comes with is AMAZING. Some type of aoili-tartar hybrid of deliciousness. Mmhmmmmmm.

After sending the waitress back 10 times because we weren't ready, the boys and I finally decided on:

Tom Yum Soup w/ Tofu: Deeeeeliciously flavored broth, BUT they seemed to have just threw a bunch of leftover veggies in there right before serving it to us because the carrots, WHITE mushrooms(wtf?) and whatever else crap in there was not soft or cooked or tender or like anything I wanted in my mouth.. (heh) but the broth itself was freakn good.

Volcano Duck: WARNING: THIS SHIT AIN'T CURRY-- my illiterate friend thought we were getting curry, but this dish is tender duck meat w/ a blast of spice. More bones and other ass veggies than duck meat, but that's what you get when you order duck. Let's be real. We all know and expect that.

Special Seafood House Noodles: Flat thick chow fun-like noodles w/ big pieces of fresh seafood- clams, shrimp, scallops, + squid. Whatever their house sauce is= YUM! I'd recommend this shiet.

Mango Trout: This is a whole fried trout with a side of mango salsa. Each of us tasted the trout on its own and unanimously thought out loud that it was kind of dry. Then we realized we were supposed to eat it WITH the mango salsa and BOOM (*mindblown*)! The mangos were SO sweet and ripe-- it complemented the trout SO well. Frickn good. Yes.

Service was good. Our food didn't take too long, the waitress was attentive and refilled our waters in a timely manner. No complaints hurrrrrr!

The place is nice, clean, modern, and well-decorated. There was a fun fact on the wall (that they maybe change once in a while..?) about Thailand having the longest capital name... then there was a paragraph of gibberish following that I couldn't understand until the end that told me all that = Bangkok. Yup.

I'd pick this place over King of Thai any day :)
author: Melissa Y.

description: My very favorite restaurant in West Portal. Good portions for the price! Pretty sure I've eaten here 3x in one week, on more than one occasion. The women who work here are really nice! My very favorite dish is the glazed tofu, followed by the pad basil
author: Ashton A.

description:
This is a nice local restaurant, a neighborhood resource in an area short of Thai. I like the quiet ambiance, the folks that own and run it, and everything we have ordered has been pretty good. Take out is ready when they say it will be, and things are well packaged for travel.

That being said, I haven't had any dishes that are really special. The pad thai with chicken is nice, and has lots of chicken, but the flavors just don't 'pop'. Both red and green curry dishes are well-prepared, everything is fresh, but as others have commented, there is a lot of sauce and not as much vegetables and meat as I would wish.

So, A-OK. Great spot to drop in when I'm in the area. But not a special place I would travel across town to visit.
author: Tom C.

description: if you walk or do something around West Portal, please do not forget to go visiting the good Thai restaurent. Everything about this restaurent is very perfect such as service, taste and ambience. I would like to recommend Chaiya restaurant to you guys. Thai food always wonderful
author: Tharnupetch L.

description:
We're new to the area and have been looking for a good thai food spot. We've tried Chaiya a few times and the delivery is totally unpredictable - sometimes they're early (yay!) and sometimes they are really late. Our experience tonight will be our last one with them because our food never arrived at all.

We placed an order on GrubHub at 7:30 p.m. and it was scheduled to arrive at 8:30 p.m. When 8:45 p.m. rolled around, I called to see when we could expect it. The person that answered the phone said it was on it's way and would be there in 10-15 minutes. I expressed my disappointment in having to wait an hour and a half for thai food from a restaurant that's not too far from my house (yes, I realize now I should have just picked it up, but this place also doesn't have parking), but we continued to wait.

15 minutes later at 9 p.m. the food still hadn't arrived, so I called to check in again. At this point they said the order had actually never been made, but they would be happy to start making it now. This means that when I called before to check on it they lied and instead of looking into the status of my order, just said what they needed to in order to get me off the phone.

Since it was now 9 p.m. and who knows how long it would take for them to make and deliver the order given their current pace, I just asked them to cancel it and refund my money.

Maybe this place is ok if you're not in any hurry to eat or want to dine in, but if you have any plans to eat in the next couple hours, you might want to try somewhere else.
author: Nicole O.

description:
A 1 star experience turned into a 5 star outcome. We've been to Chaiya many time over the past year and have always loved the food. 

One night we ordered delivery and the driver couldn't find our house (granted it's really hard to find) We spent an hour on the phone with the driver, but couldn't sort things out. We finally cancelled the order and made quesadillas for our cranky kids. About an hour later there was a knock at the door and the owner of the restaurant had a hot bag of food, apologized for the trouble and wouldn't accept any money. We appreciated the extra effort and enjoyed the food. But it gets better. The next evening as I pulled up to our house the owner was again standing at our doorway. He had prepared another meal for our family and again insisted it was on-the-house. The food was delicious and it's hard to imagine better customer service. These guys are the real deal, dedicated to their customers and committed to making awesome food.
author: Joshua S.

description: This place has been in my neighborhood for awhile but never tried it, the reason is they were kind of out of place from the main stream of West Portal area.  Wife and I love Thai food so finally we tried it ... Big Mistake, we should have tried it a long time ago.  The food is GREAT, the staff, atmosphere and decor "NICE".  Good Find 5 thumbs up.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Perfectly acceptable and predictable Thai. Used delivery.com via Yelp and order was ready on time. 

Didn't dine inside, so can't comment really on service or setting, but superficial look seemed perfectly fine. 

It's a bit out of the way, so I probably wouldn't go again for that reason.
author: Peter N.

description:
Nicole O. doesn't know what she is talking about, Grubhub is a delivery system which this place is affiliated to, so if there is anyone to blame its on grub hub for not having their drivers deliver the food right on time.

My experience dinning at this place has been excellent every single time not only because  the food was fantastic but also customer service was more than welcoming. Everytime i have brought friends here they have been delighted by this place. 

This is a great neighborhood restaurant that offers a variety of delicious meals that will make you come back for more. The thai samosas are unreal ;)
author: Ricardo V.

description:
All ya'll friends better start coming to this place for dinner.  the food here is great, the ambience totally chill, and who doesn't love Thai restaurants?

The food is pretty spectacular.  We visit about 3 Thai places regularly now, and they're all excellent but different.  Chaiya is slightly more fusion-y than the others.  The spinach noodles in particular are a real delight, and it's a dish I hadn't had anything quite like before.

My only wish: more vegetarian fake-meat options.  Currently they have a fake duck, but it's only available on a single appetizer.
author: Jon M.

description: I went to this restaurent on Monday night. I really like this restaurent because I got feel very comfortable and when you go to this restaurent I mean walk in , you will get a good feel from new atmosphere. I am extreamly love this restaurent and I am going to go there very often because I feel like eat at my home when I eat at this restaurent.
author: Saifon B.

description:
I order Ordered for delivery, too lazy to venture out. I eat a lot of Thai, and this place is by far the worst I have had.

Soft spring rolls: mostly lettuce, no avocado and the lettuce tasted wet and old. You know when the lettuce gets really wet from being a plastic bag for way too long.

papaya salad:  way, way too much garlic, gave it a bitter taste and actually could not eat it.

portions way too small for the price

I will not go back again, next time I will get my lazy a** off the couch and head over to Irving street.
author: Maria B.

description:
Dined here last saturday evening not busy.
First dish we ordered never came out so we had too ask for it unbelievable!
1) Bad, Horrible, Worthless servers...will never go back.
2) Food was ok...small portions.
author: Ron M.

description: Nice ambiance, and spacious interior. Ordered the Pad See Ew, Pad Kee Mao, and Pad Pak. The Pad See Ew and Pad Kee Mao tasted very good and the portion was on par with the competition. The amount of meat was a bit smaller than I had expected. The Pad Pak was less flavorful, but more healthy. Its portion was a bit small too. Overall, its a nice Thai place near West Portal, so worth a try to avoid having to drive farther for Thai.
author: A L.

description: Excellent food with the best service.  The calamari and pork Pad Thai was very good.  I would definitely return to this restaurant.
author: Re Y.

description: I'm not sure whether to give them 3 or 4 stars.  First off, the flavors are wonderful and super tasty.  The curry is rich and can get spicy, but is great to mop up with some rice.  My go to has been the Prik Khring and Pad C U, and I'll add something new to try.  They have been solid choices for me at times.  I ordered the Green Lantern curry to go with my main dishes, and while the curry was good and flavorful, I had noticed the same kind of vegetables was used in the Prik Khring was in the curry.  I find it a bit odd and would have liked a bit more variety in the dishes rather than a flavoring of the same ingredients.
author: Tim L.

description:
It was okay. 

This quaint little restaurant is tucked away on the residential border of West Portal. The decor is very cute and the staff was very nice. The portions were on the medium/small side. Food tasted okay; my pad kee mao was a bit too saucey for my taste. Nothing really stood out here except for the decor and cleanliness.
author: Kelly Y.

description: The food was okay it wasn't that bad but It wasn't that good. I got the lunch special, but it really was not worth it. I got my order to go and it comes with an egg roll and soup. Less than half the container was full of soup and there was only one egg roll. I was honestly expecting more because the noodles were pretty salty and the soup was literally boiled vegetable water. The egg roll was pretty much the only thing that was amazing in there. For the price it was ok, but I wouldn't pay  that amount just to get one decent egg roll  and vegetable water.
author: Yeah O.

description:
Great neighborhood Thai restaurant.

The food is pretty good and reasonable price. The portion is on a smaller size for this type of restaurant (neighborhood, casual Asian restaurant). The yellow chicken curry is probably the standout dish. 

We had 4 entrees and a soup with 1 beer, sparkling water, balboa f 1 tea for $77 including tips.

We would return!
author: Tracy L.

description:
This place needs more reviews!  It was the end of our bachelorette weekend and we ended up around West Portal to find a place to eat.  While deciding, I decided to get gas while everyone decides what to eat.  I searched thai restaurant and Yelp and this place was the first to come up.  We didn't realize we were on Claremont and the restaurant was just few steps away from us, score!  
We were a bit hesitant to go here because it had few reviews, but we figured it looked nice enough so it's worth a try.  Parking wasn't really an issue around the residential area.  We walked in and it had a nice clean ambiance.  I like the simple touches they had.  

We ordered a lot of food.  I guess we didn't realize we were that hungry.  Some of the food we ordered were golden basket, chicken satay, chicken pad basil, yellow chicken curry, pad thai, pad c u, eggplant dish, short ribs, lava chicken, and grilled chicken.  Before you think we're bunch of heffas, there were 6 of us.  Ok that was still a lot of food.  Well we did have leftover, well some of us did.  My favorites were the pad thai and chicken pad basil.  My friends liked the curry but I thought it was a bit too sweet for me.  Least favorite was the short ribs, didn't really have much flavor. 

You would think we should be stuffed but we had to end the dinner with dessert.  We all shared, or should I say devoured their pandan cake in less than 5 minutes.  The cake was moist and the sauce was good.  The coconut sorbet was a little bit icy (seems homemade) and I would see why they would use sorbet rather than ice cream... it's a good balance of texture.  

Service was good.  Our lady server warned us that we ordered a lot of food and I think she's quite surprised we devoured most of them.  They were accommodating which is great.  
We all agreed that we'll have to come back here again.  Definitely.
author: Claire J.

description: Don't usually write a review but I ordered the spinach noodles with beef to go and egg rolls. Egg rolls were fine but when I got home and opened the beef, it smelled and tasted foul. It was quite upsetting because I was very hungry and needed to throw the whole dish away. It cost $10- all in the garbage. I wouldn't recommend a restaurant that sells spoiled food to anyone.
author: Lea S.

description:
Recently remodeled, beautiful dining experience with the same great staff as Ty Bistro, Hooray!!

      The pad CU, green curry, and grilled chicken are my favorites. Yum.

     The best Thai food in San Francisco IMHO, you will find yourself coming back for more!
author: Brendan C.

description: This place is soo good. I have ordered so many amazing dishes from them that I loved and came back for ... but, tonight, I will review what I tried recently. In previous visits I always ordered the volcano duck. Interestingly, it's not sooo spicy, yet creamy with duck meat. Very delicious and good. Today I ordered the evil jungle prince with brown rice and the golden baskets. All of this is soo good. Much crab flavor in the basket, whereas many places remit the crab flavor all together in this dish golden basket crab meat/cream cheese dish. It's very good but has more crab flavor than most places with a similar offering. The spiciness of the sauce goes wonderfully with the brown rice. Idk, this place isn't often busy inside, yet I have never left this establishment unsatisfied. Food is goood. Give it a try
author: Shannon C.

description: Great Thai restaurant with nice customer service. I always call in for pick up. My favorite is the yellow curry with chicken...the wings are delish too. Very reasonable too.
author: Trish M.

description: I've been to Chaiya twice now and this is probably one of my favorite Thai food places! I've ordered the Tom sum soup, chicken eggplant, and pad thai! All three dishes were excellent!! The soup could have definitely been a little more spicy but I think they cater to the people who live around that area. The chicken eggplant was definitely my favorite dish. Seasoned perfectly and gave a good sized portion. The pad Thai was really good too! I have no complaints about it! Overall they make authentic Thai dishes that I love. I'll definitely come back for more!
author: Kelly S.

description:
We ordered delivery - their website said yellow curry comes with a cucumber salad.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(still it says on 12/27/2015: http://www.chaiyasf.com/#!pan-fried/c1m0q)
Yellow Curry
Mild yellow curry w/ potatoes, carrots, onion, & cucumber salad
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
we got the food but there was no cucumber salad. Called and asked.
They said it doesn't come with a cucumber salad. WTF? 

After explaining your website says blah blah blah....
Anyway, we said "ok then we don't need it".

The delivery person came again to deliver the missing cucumber salad, looking upset for the repeated delivery.
What he handed over to us? What are you guessing? :)
It was put in a tiny sauce container. (2oz plastic souffle cup)
They wasted more time and money to bring it to us. And they were upset?
author: Mac K.

description: On my first trip to San Francisco and I stayed in the West Portal neighborhood. I walked around for something good to eat and I ran across this place.  The server was friendly and accommodating. It was near closing but were more than willing to serve me. I had the Hawaiian fried rice and my friend had the prawns. The food was amazing and it was so good we went there the very next day. I would definitely recommend thus place you will not be disappointed.
author: Chris S.

description: I ordered delivery through Eat24 and the food was great. I ordered the golden basket appetizer, the tom ka soup with shrimp, and the yellow curry with tofu. All three dishes were awesome. The curry did not come with rice and that was a bit of a bummer but it was my fault for not checking and ordering on the side. I like really spicy things so I ordered the curry medium. It was hella spicy, almost too spicy to eat. It was still really good though. I ordered the tom ka mild and it wasn't noticeably spicy but had a great flavor. The golden basket was kind of like a Crab Rangoon. They were cooked perfectly and had a ton of cream cheese/snow crab filling. I was quoted 45-60 minute delivery and my order was delivered a little after an hour and it was still hot. I will totally order from this place again.
author: Judy S.

description:
This is the neighborhood go-to thai joint. First and foremost, their delivery is extremely fast. They are also very accommodating. After placing my order on GrubHub, I realized I forgot my wife's order. I called them 10 minutes later, they updated my order, and they still got the entire order to me within 20 minutes of originally placing it.

My Pad Kee Mao had the perfect balance of salt, sweet, and spice. The noodles were not overcooked, and the shrimp were big, plentiful, and also cooked to perfection. The same can be said for the amount/quality of shrimp in my kid's Pad Thai and my wife's fried rice.

The food quality, delivery service, consistency and the price put Chaiya at the top of their class of restaurant, which is why I'm giving them 5 stars.
author: Chris G.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place on December 15th and got food poisoning.
Beware
author: Alvaro C.

description: Went before noon on a week day. Not crowded. Great service. Excellent food. Would highly recommend.
author: Thomas W.

description:
1 star for quick delivery
1 star for big portions 

Flavor and taste were okay, much better options available.  Had the pad Thai and beef noodle soup.  

But would probably go somewhere else if I had the choice, but late night Thai food opened past 10 gets another star.  Not many options so this will more than suffice a late night craving.
author: Mike H.

description: This is our go-to restaurant when we want take-out Thai food. Their green curry is the best, but every item on the menu is a hit with my family.
author: Marcia W.

description:
Since I can't check-in so far. I'll review. 

Went here last sat w/ the girls. Got the oh so classic pad Thai and pad see ew.. How was it?! 3 magical words: Oh. So. Flavorful.

Hah. That's all. I'll be back.
author: Trang V.

description: This place has one of the best pad thai around. I remember when I had my first thai food experience...kinda late but I was a freshman in college. The first dish was a pad thai...it was so tasty and good. This place gave me that moment when I had their pad thai...lol. Their lunch time menu only cost $7 for their pad thai but the portion is not that big...but hey, it's only $7 so you get what you pay for. Other dishes are good too, but the five star is mainly for their pad thai...lol.
author: Phi N.

description:
Just ordered two portions of delivery 'pad C U'. Both came extremely mushy. Not noodle consistency at all. Taste/seasoning was good but consistency was like baby food. Very disappointed. 
Delivery was very quick.
author: Mirell S.

description:
Six of us came here on a Friday night for dinner. We arrived at 6:00 and were promptly seated.
We started off with spring rolls, chicken satay, and deep fried tofu appetizers - all delicious!

For my entree I had a green curry with rice - others  in our party had curries, soups, sea food and all said they were delicious

Service was prompt and extremely friendly - definately a 4/5 star experience
author: Bumble B.

description:
Nondescript sums up Chaiya Thai in a word. At least that's how I feel after my first visit. Yes, I was more or less satisfied with the corn fritters, pork jerky, volcano duck and siren beef that I ordered. Yet, there was something missing - subtle, but critical, that quality that motivates you to tell others how great it is, that has you planning your next visit before you've even left. Maybe it's really unique or potent flavor profiles, or great service, or high quality ingredients, or some combination thereof. Well, I didn't get any of that here. 

As I said though, the food was ok and I might go back again at some point to see if I can have the type of over the top awesome experience that so many others have yelped about.
author: Don W.

description: Food here is pretty good.  Delivery is slow however.  Told and hour, and we are up to 1:30!  I would suggest picking it up instead of delivery.
author: Mychael S.

description:
I just ordered delivery from here via stubhub. First of all, stubhub is amazing - so easy - and I'm so happy that this Thai restaurant was one of my nearby delivery choices! 

The delivery at first said approximately one hour to an hour and a half. Makes sense when you're ordering around 6pm on a Friday eve. Three minutes later, my phone updates me that the order will drive within 45-55 minutes. I thought my app/phone was going crazy, but my doorbell literally rang within that time. The delivery man was extremely nice and made sure to thank me many times and told me to enjoy my food! Usually, delivery people say hi, take their tip and bounce.

The food was great! Very fresh and still extremely warm. We ordered:

-Tom yum soup (large) with shrimp. Delicious! Just the right spice and flavor. 
-steamed veggies and shrimp topped with peanut sauce. Amazing and healthy! 
-glass noodles with veggies, shrimp and egg. Also, very good. Full of flavor. 

I will definitely order from here again! Also, will probably dine here soon (when I'm not sick)!
author: Anastasia N.

description: I am rarely compelled to write a bad yelp review but this place inspired me!  I LOVE Thai food and have eaten at many Thai restaurants in many cities, including SF. This was by far the worst Thai food I have ever had in my life. The sweet, savory flavor that you expect from Thai, were non-existent. We ordered 3 dishes and an appetizer for take out, all of which had a similar lack of flavor accompanied by a vague taste of rancidity. It was like our whole order was cooked in bad oil or something.  We paid way too much for small portions which really left a bad taste in my mouth. To top it all off, our daughter got sick that night from the noodles and tofu and we were up all night with a barfing kid.
author: Sarah A.

description:
I came here my first day at my new branch about 1.5 years ago because it was chilly and I really wanted Thai food for lunch. It's located close to the gas station on the corner and a little off the beaten path. Fairly empty because it was a weekday around 1PM for lunch

My order:
Chicken Yellow Curry $9
Brown Rice $3
Thai Ice Tea $3

The curry had a good  flavor and really soft potatoes (my favorite part of the curry). I enjoyed the Thai Ice tea as it had a good balance and wasn't watered down.

Good food & service, but around $20 for a work lunch, not something I'd want to do again. Maybe to meet up with friends for dinner though
author: Kitty K.

description: Very disappointed.  Waited over an hour for delivery.  Food was delivered cold, portion sizes were tiny and taste left something to be desired.
author: Megan S.

description: As a vegetarian, it's extremely disappointing to order a take out Papaya Salad and get home to find two slabs of STEAK over rice with a small salad on the side. Other food was just ok. I understand that mistakes happen, so I'm being generous and giving two stars.
author: Dave W.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and were intrigued by the wonderful smell of grilled meat emanating from this restaurant so we decided to give it a try and order take out. My son loves Thai food but he has nuts and eggs allergies and that make it difficult for him to eat many Thai dishes; we told the restaurant and they were really good in making sure that his dishes were allergen frees. 
Their green lantern was outstanding and the jungle carry was really good. We will definitely go back.
author: Andrea C.

description:
Tried this place for the first time about a month ago. Thai food is my favorite food and this place meets my standards. I shared two appetizers with my mom - some stuffed crab/cream cheese things that were fried (bomb) and egg rolls with silver noodles both with a sweet chili
sauce. Then we shared pad see ew with chicken which was good as well. A little pricey compared to other Thai joints I've been to but the food will make you happy.
author: Celeste M.

description:
Yup, 5.  I rarely give 5s anymore but this place gets it.  I come here quite often actually.  And tried all my favorites.  Take it from me, if you are in the area, come here and tell them Best sent you.  

Food (3/3):  I have tried a lot here.  I have to say they make it just right too, at least what I like. 
Som-tum or papaya salad is what I really like.  They make it just right.  Flavors are all there.  Sweet, sour, spicy: the flavors of Thailand.  
Grilled pork is really tender.  It too is full of flavors.  I really like how when you bite into it, it has juices and isn't dry.  
Pork jerky is different from other places. They fry it and don't fry it very dry.  I don't really think it's a jerky, but more of a fried pork, which is perfectly fine with me, because it is really good!  Juicy and savory!
Of course they have the pad Thai and pad c  u.  Those are also really good if you feel like getting the regular typical Thai foods.  I'm not a big curry fan, so I can't really advise on that.  They also make their own ice cream!  So if make sure to save some room for dessert!

Value: (1/1)
The prices are fair and you get food that I would say is worth it.  Portions are good for the price you pay so ill give it a 1.

Service and atmosphere:(1/1)
Usually, the main waitess is Cindy, but she also goes by Ring.  She is always making sure if everything is okay and friendly.  The place has more of a modern feel to it than regular traditional Thai restaurants and is a place that I would say you could take someone out on a date to.  

Overall, I'd say this is a great place to go to get Thai food!  Especially if you are in the area.  The food is good and the prices are fair.  Service is usually excellent.  I highly recommend this place!

This place passes the Best test
author: Best T.

description:
I love this restaurant. This is the most flavorful Thai food you can find in San Francisco. My wife and I used to eat here when it was Silver Spoon, lost interest when there were heavy menu changes after it became Ty Bistro but are once again very happy with it's current menu and ownership. I actually spoke with the owner who used to be one of the servers years ago when it was Silver Spoon and it's obvious she cares a lot about running a quality establishment.

Highly recommend the Evil Jungle Prince though their menu is diverse and you would be hard pressed to pick something that wasn't tasty. Also worth noting that they're vegetarian friendly! The tofu praram has artificial meat included that's so good you'll worry some mistake has been made--fear not, it's just delicious.

Every now and then, when we're feeling bold, we try other Thai restaurants in this city. None compare.
author: Blaise W.

description:
My entire family loves this place!!
The food is very delicious! I would recommend the lemon chicken and chicken satay.
The service is great; the waiters are very nice every time.
This restaurant may be a bit hard to find because it is not in the busy part of West Portal, but I would definitely recommend. You won't regret it!
author: Emma L.

description: This restaurant has a nice ambiance. Good location that is close to west portal but away from the center of everything giving it a more secluded feeling. I ordered the pad see yu- it was good but not as good as most of the other Thai places I've eaten at. serving size was pretty good size and taste was great only thing disappointing was that the only vegetable in the dish was broccoli.
author: Shav S.

description:
Chaiya Thai is a great place to have Sunday Lunch. While everyone was on their Squat and Gobble hype, my friends and I traveled down the street for some Thai food. What I encountered was a delicious meal and attentive service.

I traveled out of my comfort zone and tried the Duck Pad Thai. The duck's savory flavor dimmed down the usual sweetness I expected, creating a different flavor. It was a tasty dish that was the right portion size and cooked well. 

Service was also great. Water was refilled, we were tended to regularly, and our server even put the names of our dishes on the take out containers so we wouldn't mix them up bringing them home.

It was a great experience eating here and I'd come again.
author: Anthony A.

description:
Not only was our delivery totally delicious but it literally came faster than we could have made toast...

It was like 15 mins.  

The Tom Yum soup is super tasty and their Pad Thai is also.

We ordered through Grubhub and usually it takes an hour at least.  The driver said it wasn't too busy so he got it to us fast.  We don't even live in the neighborhood.  

We will definitely order again.
author: William G.

description: An okay Thai experience. My partner in crime ordered the spicy duck but it was overly sweet and hardly spicy. My pad thai was average. 1 bowl of white rice for $2, yeesh.
author: Gerald C.

description: My sister and I stopped by here for dinner.  We are both vegetarian (again).  We ordered a noodle dish with vegetables.  It had a lot of flavor of ginger and overall; very tasty.  We also ordered the pumpkin curry w/no meat.  We both don't really like tofu, but out server suggested fried tofu would be a nice compliment to the curry.  She was right.  I loved the pumpkin spice of the curry dish; it was very tasty with the brown rice.  We also shared the vegetable crispy egg rolls.  I will be back again.
author: Liz D.

description: I placed an order for 10 dishes and all where below average for many reasons.  The flavor was just sweet on all dishes. One dimensional!  The worst to me was the Pad Basil because it did not taste like basil at all. I had found 4 basil leaves in the whole dish.   My pad kee mow did not have any basil in it as well.  I also asked for peppers on the side and did not get any spice in my dish.
author: Gloria C.

description: Just ordered delivery. duck volcano, it was terrible...little fatty pieces of duck on dry vegetables for like 12 bucks, seriously disappointed ....the food stinks it was a first and last
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I ordered from this restaurant through Grubhub. The food didn't arrive at all. I called to the restaurant. The girl who picked up my call asked my name and said that there was no order from Grubhub at that time. I asked her to repeat my name to make sure that she got the correct spelling, then she asked my name again. Obviously, she didn't even not down my name, and simply said the order wasn't received. Lier! She even said that I might place the order to other restaurant. The restaurant name is on Grubhub! Finally, she jotted down my name and said that she had to ask the manager and call me back. No call at all! I would say that the service was worst! Deny all the responsibilities. (Last time, I ordered from this restaurant. The food was delayed for hours!)
author: Ted U.

description: Nice people, absolutely inauthentic, mediocre Thai food, at least the 2 dishes we had. The fried calamari was tasty but not particularly Thai in spice. Our $15 seafood curry tasted like the quasi-Indian shrimp curry my American mother used to make in the 1960s. Curry powder and water. So disappointing. Not a trace of Thai spice or coconut milk, even though they say their curries are "homemade." Surprised at the raves this place gets. Give me Marnee or Lers Ros or Basil Canteen any day.
author: Caroline P.

description: Get the food delivered often and it is always flavorful. Have not had one thing I didn't like. Will have to dine in sometime soon!
author: Dawn B.

description: I don't know if I caught them on a bad night but I noticed that the portion sizes on my takeout order were significantly smaller than what I'm used to from this restaurant. I hope this isn't a trend because I've always liked this place.
author: Mike D.

description:
Good solid Thai offerings.  Eggplant Merlot Dish with Beef was really good.
5 stars for what it is - a good local reliable inexpensive Thai restaurant.
author: Howard W.

description: Excellent food and service!  Been here many times and have had a lot of the dishes.  Family owned and operated, they are respectful, patient, and extremely hospitable.  Great restaurant!  I'll keep coming back!
author: Charlie V.

description: We've been ordering delivery from this place and several times the food has taken over an hour to arrive and was cold.  The food is slightly below ok and when you add the fact that it arrives late and cold, it's a total deal breaker.
author: K W.

description: I did not think the tom yum soup was at all great. It was missing taste... Like some essential ingredients were missing. Pad thai- bland... Pumpkin curry was good
author: Monika T.

description: Friendly waitress upon arrival. But she wasn't able to bring the sauce I asked her for after we had received our food. I don't know why, as the place wasn't busy at all. Food was delivered fast, but lacked any flavor. This was the second time I had been there. Decided to give it a second chance, as I thought the first time was a mistake. But , no. The food was bland. Nice ambiance , quiet, one other table was there when we were eating. Probably not coming back.
author: Natalie B.

description:
parking?  what parking.  nothing in front...not around the corner.  not in the lot down and across the street.  you've got to be LUCKY!

small, clean, not overly decorated.  some cute things like the name of the capitol written on the wall.  some pictures of someone at the door.  some paintings, looks like part of san francisco on the other wall in the dining area.  

okay.  the food.  i have heard of this place and my friend told me its spicy...and its Good!  

I can NOW confirm...he knows what he's talking about.  I ordered the Prik Khing which is String Beans, Bell Pepper, and Kaffir Lime leaves in spicy curry sauce w/chicken.  I asked how spicy because Yellow Curry is very very mild generally unless you don't put enough milk or water.  She said, its medium.  I am not really a spicy hot kind of guy...this was Medium, if you don't do hot/spicy at all...it might feel high...but for the first time, i felt.  It was just the right call on medium.

Excellent soft pieces of chicken.  Crunchy yet fully cooked string beans.  The sauce was excellent.

My friend is always about the Pad Thai noodles.  He loves them.  He just keeps saying SO GOOD!  I guess when you get so excited...you lose the ability to put feelings into worlds.  SO GOOD!  LOL!
author: Bing D.

description: Great Thai spot just up the block from West Portal.  The prices were very reasonable, and the servers were extremely friendly.  This will now be my go-to Thai spot in the West Portal/Sunset area.
author: E R.

description: Service was good. Food wasn't great - really bland and boring. It smells so good everytime I walk by this place that I was hoping for better but I wasn't impressed. We ordered the volcano duck (too syrupy) and pad thai (not enough flavour) Bummer.
author: Emma M.

description: Thought this was a decent place and might have given them 3-4 stars, but we ordered take-out tonight, and the green curry had a giant hair in it, and they delivered the wrong soup. Disappointing, and, well, yuck.
author: S W.

description: Worst ever, spring rolls just lettuce, soup very small, chicken satay terrible , like rubber. Way over priced for what u got
author: Martin P.

description: Be warned! This is the worst Thai food in the city! My wife and I went for lunch at 12 45 PM on a Friday and the place was empty. That should have told me what we were about to experience. The "spring roll" appetizer was cold and greasy. The shrimp appetizer was tough and also cold. The chicken curry was bland and tasteless. There were just a few pieces of chicken. All in all I felt cheated and defrauded in that no restaurant should put out food like that. If you want good Thai try Marni Thai on 9th avenue near Irving
author: David R.

description: Whatever hiccups they had during the change of hands has been worked out.  The food is back, the place is clean and the kids working there are very nice.
author: Peter R.

description: Food was okay. A bit stingy with the shrimp in the shrimp fried rice. Customer service was above average.
author: Lanre O.

description:
We decided to give this place a 2nd try but this time for lunch.
1. Pad Thai - with chicken, $9.  Chicken pieces were sort of dry, the noodles are thin and was over cooked.  Bean spouts and chopped peanuts were served on the side.  Didn't look like there was that much tofu.  As another reviewer indicated, "I've had better". 
2. Tom Yum soup for one, $4. Just as spicy and tart as the 1st time.  I like the flavor and there were 2-3 prawns in the soup, lots of mushrooms, tomatoes.  
3. Chicken Laab, $12.  Used to be a Thai place on Balboa St in the Outer Richmond that made the best Laab in my opinion.  This one was spicy but just didn't have the flavor compared to the old place.  Other places serve it with regular iceberg lettuce, this place has a small pile of spring salad, didn't quite fit with traditional Thai laab.
I wouldn't order this one again.
4.  Dessert - now, the Pandan Cake, $7 is worth every calorie and every bite. A wedge of a green colored cake, topped with a green cornstarchy like sauce with oodles of coconut flakes in it and served with a large scoop of ice-milk coconut sorbet topped with a sprinkle of granola.  I would skip the laab and had the soup with the dessert.  

As I stated before, some dishes are hit or miss.  The waiter couldn't tell me what type of sweetener was used in the Thai iced tea, $3.  It was sort of weak and he gave it to me and forgot the Half and Half and had to go back to put it in.  The waitress told me it was sugar they used, so I skipped the sweetener as I thought it would be condensed milk.  The wait staff still struggles with English comprehension. She couldn't explain to me was ingredients were in the Pandan cake and stated, "I don't know the word".  Food service was slow considering there were only 4 of us in the whole place.  
Our order was placed first but the other 2 diners got their food first and Hubby was getting annoyed about the wait and we had to ask a couple of times about the food and they said "It's coming".  

For a second visit, I'd recommend the green curry, Pandan cake dessert and Tom Yum soup only if you can handle the spicy and tartness.
author: Ry T.

description: One of my favorite Thai places in the city. The service is great, the place is nice inside and the food is always fresh and well prepared. This is our go to place during the week when we dont want to cook.
author: Alexander K.

description: Ordered the Beef Pad Thai & Chicken Fried Rice via Seamless (delivery) and this immediately became my first go-to meal after I moved into the neighborhood. So damn delicious!
author: Shannon K.

description: I've been to this restaurant several times and it was one of my favorites in San Francisco. However, I went a few days ago and the food and service was very different. I was poured a very small glass of wine, the pad thai was not nearly as flavorful as it usually is, the chicken was not marinated well, and the tofu in my pineapple rice was burnt and hard to chew. Overall it was a very sad experience. Whatever has happened in the past few weeks is not good.
author: Saralee L.

description: Best thai food ive had in SF . Its a step up from the oh so popular chabba. Definitely better than bangkok and king of thai, you feel like you dont even want to go back to rhose places after trying chaiya. Delivery is also fast and service is on point.
author: Daniel K.

description: Nice place, great service.  We ordered an appetizer and two main dishes and really liked all three.  I eat a lot of Thai food and thought this was really good.  I would make it my go to spot in the West Portal area for Thai.
author: Patricia M.

description: Tom Yum soup with prawn and green curry are old favorites and really tasty and we prepared. We will be back.
author: Essjay W.

description: Used to be TY Bistro.  You can expect the same great food and service here.  I've brought many friends here, and we always leave happy and full.  The Currys are amazing
author: Courtney W.

description: First time ever, out on a walk spur of moment. The dinning room was casual with cloth covered tables. There was a table with a mom and 2 kids. I ordered the Tom Kha soup. Nothing usuall, a standard at Thai restaurant.  I ordered the large family size thinking about lunch the following day. It was ready in less than 10 minutes. I was first disappointed seeing that the container was barly 3/4 full.  The broth was like watered down versions I've had. I ordered with chicken. There was very small pieces and not much. Then there was 2 or 3 small mushrooms floating on top. The taste was bland, mushrooms tasteless and lacking any  of the flavors from lemongrass, galangal and Kaffir leaves. Usually you see those things. Not a speck that I could see or taste.  Very bad first time and it's a simple dish that a Thai restaurant should have mastered.  I ended up making a milkshake and tossed the soup. I don't think I'll try it again. With so many excellent choices in the city why would I risk another bad meal.
author: Claudia S.

description: Chaiya (formerly Ty Bistro) is one of the best neighborhood Thai restaurants in the city. The food is simply wonderful, the decor pleasant and the staff attentive and friendly, especially the manager Sarinee. Prices are very reasonable. We've been going for quite a while and even threw a birthday party there which was a hit with friends and family. They stay open fairly late which is great for sleepy West Portal.
author: Max T.

description: I am a huge fan of Thai food and have tried many Thai restaurant in the city. Unfortunately, Chayia is at the bottom of my list... We ordered pad Thai, basil chicken and red curry with beef. The three dishes looked quite unappetizing. The taste wasn't any better: all the meats were dry and the basil chicken tasted more boiled than stir- fried. Nothing looked freshly made. I am very sad to say that there was nothing exciting about the dishes we ordered. We won't order there again :(.
author: Anastasia M.

description: One star for food arriving on time.  Chicken for the Laarb was gross, hope we don't get sick.  Curry for the Panang was bleh and the rice was not cooked properly.  Things need to be fixed at this restaurant.
author: Marc B.

description: We ordered and were told an hour wait for a restaurant that is 10 minutes from our house.  After an hour and a half we called, it finally showed up after 2 hours -- cold!  The driver could not seem to use Google maps.  Never again.
author: Theresa M.

description: Decent thai food but this place used to be better (previously known as ty bistro).  Green curry is mediocre.  Had the chicken green curry and the chicken seemed cheap.  Also had the pad thai here and there was just something off about it.  When there is so much good thai food in the area unlikely that I'll be back after a couple not so great visits here.
author: Annabelle K.

description: Thai food for grownups: complex flavors, lots of fresh veggies, spicy curry.  Corn fritters were especially good.
author: Kelly R.

description: Wow!!! Best thai food in SF. I've only eaten at a half dozen thai joints in sf, this is by far my favorite, no questions or comparisons!!! I went there with my fiance and started off with Blanketed Shrimp (Lady finders) which were devoured in a couple minutes-PERFECT, Tom Yum Soup/shrimp which was not too sour, perfectly spiced,  and more on the brothy side which I love! Next came the Beef Waterfall Salad, all I can say is it was the greatest salad any true carnivore could ask for! The description is : Charcoal prime ribs seasoned with herbs, mint leaves red onions, scallions and dried chili pepper tossed in lime juice....if this sounds amazing to you, IT IS!!! We also ordered Hawaiian Fried rice which was good but a little on the sweet side (should have gone with Thai Fried Rice), Next up was Green Curry / Pork with side of white rice and side of peanut sauce (it was freakin awesome) for me and Chaiya grilled Beef Short Ribs, both were 5 star!!! The portions were fantastic on everything! I washed it all down with some yummy thai iced tea and a thai beer. No room for dessert (which I would have tried their FBI-Fried banana ice cream) but went home with a big doggy bag. Cindy was our female server and didn't catch the name of our male server, both were very attentive, and super nice. We over did the ordering on purpose, we wanted take home, and to get a good sample of their offerings. I could get by on Just the beef waterfall salad, and cup of soup I am sure. This is a long review but I was truly stoked by running into this place. Nice decor and peaceful ambience, nice to bring a date for sure, also saw several people in and out for pickup on take-out orders so looked like they do take out right as well. For me this place compares to Krung Thai in San Jose, these are the two best Thai joints I've eaten at!
author: David N.

description: Finally found great Thai food again!  Only two reviews before me and they were both 5-star.  So I thought I'd also give Chaiya a try and was not disappointed.  Everything we had for take out was delicious.  New favorite Thai in SF.
author: Bradley T.

description: This is one of the hidden gems that everyone loves to discover.  As devout Thai eaters, we've dined all over the city for years searching for the best Thai restaurants.  There are some good ones in SF, and everyone has their favorite.  However, Chaiya Thai completely surprised us.  They are located in an out of the way location in West Portal, making walk-ins rare.  So it doesn't seem like much from the outside.  But the food is some of the best we have had in the city.  And we are picky.
