This is a must try place for foodies into Thai, and for folks anywhere within a few miles of West Portal.  Our favorites are the curries (green, especially) and the appetizers.  You will be happy you tried it.
author: John W.

description: Just threw out the take-out. The seafood in the soup tasted stale. Some vegetables in the soup were colder then others. The breaded fish was soggy. The fresh roll was 95% lettuce and that's all. The dipping sauce was OK, not stellar. The beef was not very flavorful, but at least it wasn't ground beef, which some other Thai restaurants sell.  Overall disappointing.
author: Don m.

description:
My first visit to Chaiya was a pleasant surprise. Tucked away behind the busy West Portal shopping area, it delivered more than its modest appearance promised.  Simple, sparse decor, but comfortable seating with pillows to adjust for settling in for a lovely, relaxing  meal.  The Tom Yum soup had the right amount of spice and generous sized and abundant chunks of vegetables and tofu.  The pumpkin curry dish we ordered was also filled to the brim with tender pieces of the vegetable, and the meat which we intentionally omitted was not missed; the sauce was exquisitely creamy  over brown rice..  Crispy prawns were a tasty and satisfying appetizer for three of our group of four.  One of my friends, who is struggling with a dietary problem,  was able to enjoy a dish made exactly as she had requested.  Accommodating staff, delicious food and a great value for the cost, Nary a complaint, Chaiya will be recommended highly to my friends who enjoy homey Thai food..  . 

L. Marie, San Francisco November 15, 2013
author: Henrietta L.

description: I like most everything about this place.  I usually get the yellow curry dishes which are better than most I have had.  The staff are super friendly and the prices are right.  Newly refurbished in a space where a lot of restaurants have been over the past 10 years.  You should give it a try.
author: David B.

description: This place feels more upscale than most other Thai places, but the prices are very affordable.  I was afraid it was one of those places with a nice ambience but horrible food, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The dishes tasted authentic and delicious.   It's one of the better Thai places I've had around here and will definitely be choosing it over some of the other restaurants closer to my house.  Overall, it's good food, affordable prices, and nice ambience.  Great value.
author: B J.

description: we just ordered and ate delivery... the food tasted great... two hours later both myself & my husband feel terribly ill... we are & ordered vegetarian... maybe fish sauce, maybe food poisoning?
author: Deborah M.

description: Ordered take out here last night.  When we arrived home the order was wrong so we contacted them and they didn't even apologies.  We had to return in order to collect the correct dish.  Despite the error being their fault I had to sit and wait 20 minutes for the original dish I had ordered.  They then took back the dish they had originally given to us.  I had expected that they'd insist we keep it as a gesture for the inconvenience of having to drive back to the restaurant but nope, no doubt it was reheated and given to another customer.  The girl didn't even offer an apology for the error or for leaving me sitting another 20 minutes.  The place itself is very basic, clean enough but the service is so slow.  Only one person to take phone orders, serve seated customers and serve take out clients.   While I waited for my take out I thought the service was all over the place.  People at the same tables receiving their meals at different times and there were only four tables of people in total.  The place is just under staffed and as a result the customer service is very poor.   That said, the dish that we ordered  (green curry) was really good but miserable amount of chicken.  I would recommend take out for sure but if your in a hurry forget it!
author: Jackie L.
